p: Liposomes: Liposomes are made with many phospholipids bilayers vesicles enclosing an internal aqueous volume [ 107]. The growing interest in liposomes can be attributed mainly to their property of mimicking biological cells. Accordingly, liposomes are highly biocompatible, making them an ideal candidate for a drug delivery system, with applications ranging from delivering enzymes, antibacterial drugs, fungicides, and adjuvants for vaccines [ 108]. The membrane structure can vary significantly, making it possible to create different liposomes with diverse characteristics and applications [ 109].
